segments.key_quote: This indicates that Bhismadeva is a very, very great personality not only recognized as a great personality on this earth planet but also in the upper planets even by the devatas
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam and highlights Bhismadeva's greatness, recognized both on Earth and in the higher planets.
segments.transcript: In this session, we will be discussing from the 45th verse of the 9th chapter of the 1st canto of Shri Madbhagavatam: Tatra Dundubhayo Neduhu Deva Manava Vaditaha Shashamsuhu Sadavo Radyam Khadpetu Pushpa Vrishdayaha. Thereafter, both men and demigods sounded drums in honor, and the honest royal order commenced demonstrations of honor and respect, and from the sky fell showers of flowers. This indicates that Bhismadeva is a very, very great personality, not only recognized as a great personality on this earth planet but also in the upper planets, even by the devatas.

segments.key_quote: Although he was a human being, as Bhishma he was a human being. But his position was on the level of Brahma.
segments.summary: The speaker explains Bhismadeva's position as a Mahajana, comparing him to Brahma, Narada, and Shiva, emphasizing his spiritual perfection.
segments.transcript: That is the greatness of Bhismadeva. So, in the purport, Sri Laprabhupada explains the significance of this way of showing respect to Bhishma Deva. Bhishma Deva was respected both by the human beings and by the demigods. The human beings live on earth and similar other planets in the Bhur and Bhuvara group of planets. Bhuloka, Bhuvarloka. Bhuloka is the earthly planetary system. There are planets which are on this level of the Bhuloka. Loka means a group of planets belonging to a similar category. Bhuvarloka is above Bhuloka, but that is also a planetary system where the humans live, human beings live. But the demigods live in the Svarloka group. Svarloka, heavenly planets. And all of them knew Bhishma Deva as a great warrior and devotee of the Lord. So what is Bhishma Deva's position actually? As a Mahajana or authority, he was on the level of Brahma, Narada, and Shiva. Although he was a human being, as Bhishma he was a human being, but his position was on the level of Brahma. Three other Mahajanas are being mentioned by Prabhupad here. Brahma is the topmost personality in the whole universe. Shiva is greater than even Brahma. Among the Devatas, Shiva is called Mahadeva, greater than even Brahma. And Narada, the topmost devotee of the lord in the whole universe, so Bhishma's position was in an equal level as a Mahajana.

segments.key_quote: jayanti is exclusively reserved for the supreme lord and his pure devotees not for other people who are spiritually ignorant though they may be materially very very accomplished
segments.summary: The lecture distinguishes between honoring spiritually advanced souls and the misuse of 'Jayanti' ceremonies for ordinary people, reserving it for the Lord and His pure devotees.
segments.transcript: special ceremonies are observed for such spiritual bodies. The respect and recognition of Bhishma Deva never to be imitated by artificial means as it has become a fashion to observe the so-called jayanti ceremony for any and every common man nowadays, even those who are not spiritually advanced or spiritually perfect, even for them they observe what is called as jayanti ceremony. According to authorized shastras, such a jayanti ceremony for an ordinary man, however exalted he may be materially, is an offense to the body of the lord.
